title: SecureGaze: Defending Gaze Estimation Against Backdoor Attacks
author: Lingyu Du (Delft University of Technology), Jinyuan Jia (The Pennsylvania State University), Yupei Liu (The Pennsylvania State University), Guohao Lan (Delft University of Technology), ...
relevance_why: This paper explores the vulnerabilities of gaze estimation models to backdoor attacks, similar to potential vulnerabilities in audio models. Methods developed could inspire defenses in audio-based systems.
background: Gaze estimation aims to determine the direction a person is looking based on images of their face, which can be manipulated by adversarial triggers leading to incorrect gaze direction outputs.
contribution: This paper introduces SecureGaze to protect gaze estimation models from backdoor attacks, achieving effective detection and mitigation of adversarial manipulations.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous defenses focus on static classification models and rely on specific feature activations to identify vulnerabilities.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work addresses unique characteristics of gaze estimation, developing techniques that consider all features and the continuous output space of regression tasks, which were not suitable for previous methods.

key_innovation: SecureGaze utilizes reverse engineering of trigger functions based on identified vulnerabilities in the continuous output space of gaze estimation models.
real_world_impact: The defense framework provided by SecureGaze can enhance the safety and reliability of gaze-based systems in critical applications like driver monitoring and augmented reality interfaces.
limitations: The approach may have limitations in real-time execution speed or scalability regarding diverse datasets.

new_terms.backdoor attack: **Backdoor attack** refers to a method where adversaries manipulate the training process of models, making them respond in desired ways only when specific triggers are input.
new_terms.gaze estimation: **Gaze estimation** is the process of determining an individual's gaze direction by analyzing visual data, often through images of their face.

open_sourcing: The implementation of SecureGaze will be publicly available at https://github.com/LingyuDu/SecureGaze.
